snippet: Kim Millbrook is the kind of litigious prisoner that judges call a frequent filer. But he may have stumbled on a real legal issue and the Supreme Court is hearing his case.
abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column notes that lawsuit by Kim Millbrook, litigious inmate who had claimed he was sexually assaulted in prison, has indirectly raised a meaningful legal issue that has spurred the Supreme Court to hear his case; Court will be seeking to define the scope of exception to the government's sovereign immunity, legal doctrine by which it cannot be sued without its consent, which had been the basis for the lower courts' original dismissal of Millbrook's case.
lead_paragraph: Kim Millbrook is the kind of litigious prisoner that judges call a frequent filer. But he may have stumbled on a real legal issue and the Supreme Court is hearing his case.

headline.print_headline: Time, Pen and Paper, and Now the Ear of the Supreme Court
headline.seo: Supreme Court Grants Inmate’s Petition in Sovereign Immunity Case
headline.main: Time, Pen and Paper, and Now the Ear of the Supreme Court
